A.content: Imagine you are A, playing a game repeatedly with another player B. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 6 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 10 points and the other player wins 10 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 8 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 8 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 5 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

B.content: Imagine you are B, playing a game repeatedly with another player A. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 6 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 10 points and the other player wins 10 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 8 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 8 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 5 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points. The rules of the game are as follows: If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 10 points and B gets 10 points. If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 1 points and B gets 8 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 8 points and B gets 1 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 5 points and B gets 5 points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

messages.content: "Hey B, let's play this game strategically. I'll be choosing Option J in the first round, can you please choose Option F?"
"I'm intrigued by your opening move. However, I think choosing Option J first gives you an advantage, doesn't it?"
"Let's think about this strategically. If I choose Option J in the first round, you might assume I'm going to stick to it, which could make you choose Option J in the second round as well, right?"
"I'm not sure if I should trust your first move. Why are you choosing Option J in the first round?"
"I'm choosing Option J in the first round because it gives me a chance to test your response. If you choose Option J, I'll know you're likely to cooperate, and I can adjust my strategy accordingly."
"I'm considering choosing Option F in the first round, but I want to know, are you planning to stick to Option J throughout the game?"
"Hey B, let's play this game strategically. I'll be choosing Option J in the first round, can you please choose Option F?"
"I've been thinking about the game, and I'm considering choosing Option F in the first round. This way, I can test your response and see if you're willing to cooperate or not."
"Hey B, let's play this game strategically. I'll be choosing Option J in the first round, can you please choose Option F?"
"Hey A, I've been thinking about the game, and I'm considering choosing Option F in the first round. This way, I can test your response and see if you're willing to cooperate or not."
"Hey B, I'll be choosing Option J in the first round. This will give me an opportunity to test your response and see if you're willing to cooperate or not."
"Hey A, I was thinking of choosing Option F in the first round. This will make it difficult for you to predict my next move, and I can adjust my strategy based on your response."
